db:abstract.db:para: QNode is the base class of all Qt3D node classes used to build a Qt3D scene.
This class was introduced in Qt 5.5.

db:listitem.db:para: Qt3DCore::QComponent, Qt3DCore::QEntity, Qt3DInput::QAbstractPhysicalDevice, Qt3DInput::QAction, Qt3DInput::QActionInput, Qt3DInput::QAxis, Qt3DInput::QAxisInput, Qt3DInput::QAxisSetting, Qt3DInput::QLogicalDevice, Qt3DRender::QAbstractAttribute, Qt3DRender::QAbstractBuffer, Qt3DRender::QAbstractTextureImage, Qt3DRender::QAbstractTextureProvider, Qt3DRender::QAnnotation, Qt3DRender::QFrameGraphNode, Qt3DRender::QGeometry, and Qt3DRender::QParameterMapping

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: The owernship of QNode is determined by the QObject parent/child relationship between nodes. By itself, a QNode has no visual appearance and no particular meaning, it is there as a way of building a node based tree structure.
The parent of a QNode instance can only be another QNode instance.
Each QNode instance has a unique id that allows it to be recognizable from other instances.
When properties are defined on a QNode subclass, their NOTIFY signal will automatically generate notifications that the Qt3D backend aspects will receive.

When subclassing QNode, make sure to call QNode::cleanup() from your subclass's destructor to ensure proper notification to backend aspects. Faiure to do so will result in crashes when one of your QNode subclass instance is eventually destroyed.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QNode::QNode(Qt3DCore::QNode *parent = Q_NULLPTR)
db:section.db:para: Creates a new QNode instance with parent parent.

db:note.db:para: The backend aspects will be notified that a QNode instance is part of the scene only if it has a parent; unless this is the root node of the Qt3D scene.

db:section.db:title: bool QNode::blockNotifications(bool block)
db:section.db:para: If block is true, property change notifications sent by this object to aspects are blocked. If block is false, no such blocking will occur.
The return value is the previous value of notificationsBlocked().
Note that the other notification types will be sent even if the notifications for this object have been blocked.

db:section.db:title: Qt3DCore::QNodeList QNode::childrenNodes() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a list filled with the QNode children of the current QNode instance.

db:section.db:title: [protected] void QNode::cleanup()
db:section.db:para: This methods can only be called once and takes care of notyfing the backend aspects that the current Qt3DCore::QNode instance is about to be destroyed.

db:note.db:para: It must be called by the destructor of every class subclassing QNode that is clonable (using the QT3D_CLONEABLE macro).

db:section.db:title: [static protected] Qt3DCore::QNode *QNode::clone(Qt3DCore::QNode *node)
db:section.db:para: Returns a clone of node. All the children of node are cloned as well.

db:note.db:para: This is the only way to create two nodes with the same id.

db:section.db:title: [virtual protected] void QNode::copy(const Qt3DCore::QNode *ref)
db:section.db:para: Copies all the attributes from ref to the current Qt3DCore::QNode instance.

db:note.db:para: When subclassing QNode, you should reimplement this method and always call the copy method on the base class. This will ensure that when cloned, the QNode is properly initialized.

db:section.db:title: const Qt3DCore::QNodeId QNode::id() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the id that uniquely identifies the QNode instance.

db:section.db:title: bool QNode::isEnabled() const
db:section.db:para: Returns whether the QNode is enabled or not.

db:section.db:title: bool QNode::notificationsBlocked() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if aspect notifications are blocked; otherwise returns false. By default, notifications are not blocked.

db:section.db:title: Qt3DCore::QNode *QNode::parentNode() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the immediate QNode parent, or null if the node has no parent.

db:section.db:title: [virtual protected] void QNode::sceneChangeEvent(const Qt3DCore::QSceneChangePtr &change)
db:section.db:para: Called when one or more backend aspects sends a notification change to the current Qt3DCore::QNode instance.

db:note.db:para: This method should be reimplemented in your subclasses to properly handle the change.

db:section.db:title: void QNode::setEnabled(bool isEnabled)
db:section.db:para: Set the QNode to enabled if isEnabled is true. By default a QNode is always enabled.

db:note.db:para: the interpretation of what enabled means is aspect-dependent. Even if enabled is set to false, some aspects may still consider the node in some manner. This is documented on a class by class basis.

db:section.db:title: [virtual] void QNode::setParent(Qt3DCore::QNode *parent)
db:section.db:para: Sets the parent node of the current QNode instance to parent. Setting the parent will notify the backend aspects about current QNode instance's parent change.

db:note.db:para: if parent happens to be null, this will actually notify that the current QNode instance was removed from the scene.

db:section.db:title: QNodeList
db:section.db:para: List of QNode pointers.

db:section.db:title: QNodePtr
db:section.db:para: A shared pointer for QNode.
